newsitem.title: DENMARK: Unidanmark rejects Swedish merger rumours.
newsitem.headline: Unidanmark rejects Swedish merger rumours.

text.p: Unidanmark, Denmark's second biggest bank, rejected on Tuesday market rumours of a possible merger with Sweden's Nordbanken which have triggered sharp rises in Danish bank shares.
"I can only dismiss all rumours about a merger between Nordbanken and us," Unidanmark information chief Hans Joergen Sooes told Reuters.
"Unidanmark is not engaged in any negotiations with Nordbanken," he said.
The latest wave of merger speculation was prompted by the surprise collapse of merger talks in Stockholm on Monday between Swedish commercial bank S-E-Banken and state-controlled Nordbanken.

The rumours of a possible merger between Unidanmark and Nordbanken are not new in Denmark, but they caused Unidanmark shares to soar nine crowns to 349, pushing the top-20 KFX index to a new record closing high of 149.96 on Monday.
At the same time, rival Den Danske Bank A/S, Denmark's biggest bank, put on 14 crowns to end the day at 531.

Bank stock continued to climb on the Copenhagen Bourse on Tuesday, with Unidanmark eight crowns up at 357 and Den Danske Bank 10 higher at 541 at 1220 gmt and dealers forecast another record closing high for the KFX index.
